job_description:
Product Manager – AI SaaS Products

Location: Kochi, India Division: Linnk Innovations – Research & Development Brand: LinnkIQ Reports To: Head of Product / CTO

About LinnkIQ LinnkIQ is Linnk Group’s next-generation AI-native product suite, designed to transform global staffing operations. The platform includes: - LinnkMe – AI-enhanced CRM/ATS for consultants and recruiters - LinnkUS – Conversational AI Communication Hub (Chatbot, Voice AI, Automation Engine) - LinnkUp – Intelligent ERP (Finance, Workforce, Projects, Compliance)

These products form a unified ecosystem that automates, accelerates, and elevates how recruitment teams engage candidates, clients, and workflows globally.

Role Overview We are seeking a highly capable Product Manager with proven experience developing AI-driven SaaS products to take ownership of either LinnkMe (CRM/ATS) or LinnkUS (AI Chatbot & Communication Hub). This role sits within Linnk Innovations, our dedicated R&D division in Kochi.

As Product Manager, you will drive the strategy, roadmap, and execution of one core LinnkIQ product module. You will collaborate with AI engineers, software developers, UX designers, business analysts, and global operational teams to deliver intelligent, scalable, and user-centric capabilities.

Key Responsibilities

Product Ownership & Strategy - Own the end-to-end product lifecycle for LinnkMe CRM/ATS or LinnkUS AI Chatbot. - Define and execute the product roadmap aligned with business objectives and the broader LinnkIQ ecosystem. - Translate complex workflows into simple, intelligent, automation-driven user experiences. - Ensure seamless interoperability with LinnkUp (ERP) and other LinnkIQ modules.

AI-Led Product Development - Lead the development of AI-powered features including: - LLM-driven matching, summarisation, insights, scoring - RAG-based retrieval and knowledge workflows - Chatbot and voice AI interactions - Automated conversations and decision flows - Workflow automation, triggers, orchestration, and multi-step logic - Define AI requirements, prompts, guardrails, quality thresholds, and behavioural patterns. - Work with AI engineers to test, evaluate, refine, and optimise model outputs.

Framework & Process Creation for AI-Scaled Products - Develop scalable AI product frameworks, including: - conversation design systems (text & voice) - automation blueprints - evaluation standards and guardrails - multi-tier workflow architectures - reusable LLM prompt libraries - Create systematic processes for designing, testing, and deploying AI features. - Establish best practices for safe AI usage, reliability, transparency, and continuous improvement.

Research & Innovation - Conduct deep research into recruitment workflows, user behaviour, market trends, and emerging AI capabilities. - Benchmark global ATS, CRM, and AI communication systems to inspire product improvements. - Translate R&D insights into scalable prototypes and roadmap features. - Lead structured experimentation cycles for new AI capabilities and automation concepts.

Product Execution & Delivery - Write PRDs, user stories, acceptance criteria, and high-quality product documentation. - Drive agile delivery cycles across engineering, AI, QA, and UX. - Conduct product walkthroughs, demos, and user testing sessions. - Manage feature prioritisation, dependency planning, and release readiness.

Analytics & Continuous Improvement - Monitor product KPIs such as user adoption, workflow efficiency, automation success rates, and AI accuracy. - Analyse behavioural data to enhance features and reduce user friction. - Lead optimisation cycles for AI-driven interactions, logic patterns, and decision flows.

Experience Requirements Essential - 5–10 years of Product Management experience in SaaS or enterprise platforms. - Minimum 2+ years delivering AI-powered products, including LLM or conversational AI systems. - Proven track record scaling ATS, CRM, HR-Tech, Chatbot, or workflow automation systems. - Experience designing frameworks, processes, and models for AI-driven features. - Strong technical fluency: APIs, cloud architecture, data models, microservices. - Demonstrated success managing cross-functional product delivery in fast-paced environments.

Desirable - Experience in staffing, HR-Tech, recruitment, CRM/ATS or ERP domains. - Experience in innovation labs, incubators, or R&D-focused product teams. - Understanding of enterprise compliance, data privacy, and secure multi-region SaaS deployment.

Key Skills & Competencies

AI & Automation Expertise - Strong grasp of LLMs, embeddings, RAG, and conversational design. - Ability to evaluate AI correctness, safety, behavioural consistency, and performance. - Knowledge of automation engines, workflow logic, and orchestration systems.

Technical Product Leadership - Ability to collaborate closely with developers, AI engineers, and architects. - Skilled in reviewing logic flows, data structures, and integration patterns. - Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Product Excellence - Exceptional prioritisation, strategic planning, and outcome-driven thinking. - Ability to simplify complex workflows into intuitive UX patterns. - Strong user empathy with consultants, candidates, clients, and back-office teams.

Collaboration & Communication - Excellent communication skills across technical and non-technical audiences. - Proven ability to influence stakeholders and lead cross-functional teams. - High ownership, resilience, and adaptability.

Why Join Linnk Innovations? - Be part of one of the industry’s first fully AI-native staffing platforms. - Work inside a fast-moving R&D organisation where innovation is core, not optional. - Build products used globally across six regions. - Shape the frameworks, standards, and methodologies that define the future of AI in recruitment. - Influence how consultants, clients, and candidates interact with the entire Linnk ecosystem.

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at shibu.melath@linnk.com.
summary: Lead AI-driven SaaS product development for LinnkIQ's CRM/ATS or AI Chatbot, shaping AI frameworks and automation workflows in a global R&D environment.

Job Summary

As the Business Analyst at Linnk Group, you will translate business requirements into functional specifications, facilitate communication between stakeholders, and ensure the successful delivery of technology solutions. You will collaborate closely with product managers, developers, and stakeholders to gather and analyze requirements, document user stories, and define acceptance criteria for software development projects. With a keen eye for detail and a strong understanding of business processes, you will bridge the gap between business needs and technical solutions.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in software development, Computer Science, or Management.

Experience

  • Proven experience as a Business Analyst or similar role, preferably in software development or technology consulting. Preferably SAAS product.
  • Knowledge of agile development methodologies (e.g., Scrum, Kanban) and experience with requirements management tools (e.g., Jira, Trello) is preferred.

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand objectives, processes, and requirements.
  • Work with technical teams to design solutions aligned with business goals.
  • Evaluate technology solutions and recommend based on business value and feasibility.
  • Develop prototypes or proof of concepts.
  • Assist in project planning, scheduling, and coordination.
  • Monitor project progress and ensure timely, on-scope deliverables.
  • Identify and mitigate risks/issues impacting project success.
  • Facilitate communication between stakeholders and technical teams.
  • Present findings, updates, and recommendations to stakeholders.
  • Align business requirements with technical solutions.
  • Define test cases and scenarios based on requirements.
  • Conduct user acceptance testing (UAT) and coordinate stakeholder feedback.
  • Stay informed on industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies.
  • Identify opportunities for process improvement or innovation.

Key Competencies (Skills)

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to translate complex business processes into actionable requirements.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to interact effectively with stakeholders at all levels.
  • Detail-oriented mindset with accuracy in documenting requirements and specifications.

Contact: Share your resume at shibu.melath@linnk.com
summary: Senior Business Analyst translates business needs into technical solutions, collaborating with stakeholders and technical teams to ensure project success.

This role designs and reviews security controls for applications, integrations, data, infrastructure, and identities to ensure confidentiality, integrity, and availability. The Security Architect collaborates with application, integration, infrastructure, network, and DevOps teams to embed security into legacy system modernization (microservices/containerized workloads) while meeting regulatory, audit, and compliance requirements.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define security architecture and reference patterns for applications, APIs, integrations, and data flows across on-premises environments.
  • Establish security standards for identity and access management (SSO, MFA, RBAC), network security (segmentation, firewalls, VPNs), and endpoint protection.
  • Collaborate with teams to secure microservices, web apps, mobile clients, and external APIs (authentication, authorization, input validation).
  • Ensure secure configurations for servers, containers, Kubernetes/OpenShift clusters, databases, load balancers, and WAFs.
  • Define security controls for external integrations (government systems, third-party services) with secure connectivity and data protection.
  • Oversee logging, monitoring, and alerting for security events, working with SIEM/SOC teams for threat detection and response.
  • Embed security into SDLC/DevSecOps via threat modeling, SAST/DAST testing, and CI/CD pipeline integration.
  • Conduct architecture reviews for compliance with security and regulatory requirements.
  • Maintain security baselines, hardening guides, and configuration benchmarks.

Preferred Technical Skills

  • Enterprise security architecture for on-premises/hybrid environments.
  • IAM technologies (Active Directory/LDAP, SSO, MFA, OAuth2, OpenID Connect).
  • Application security fundamentals (OWASP Top 10, secure coding, session management).
  • Network security (firewalls, WAFs, secure remote access).
  • Container security (Docker, Kubernetes/OpenShift, image scanning).
  • Database security (encryption, hardening, Oracle).
  • Security logging/monitoring (SIEM platforms, centralized analytics).

Experience & Soft Skills

  • 10+ years in information security, with 3-4 years in a security architect role.
  • Proven experience in large-scale, mission-critical systems with uptime/compliance requirements.
  • Multi-datacenter/DR environment expertise (failover, replication, HA security).
  • Cross-functional collaboration (application, infrastructure, DevOps, network teams).
  • Excellent communication skills for technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Additional Responsibilities

  • Lead threat modeling/risk assessments and translate findings into controls.
  • Define secure access policies (privileged access, just-in-time access).
  • Support incident response/forensics with logging/evidence collection.
  • Contribute to business continuity/DR planning from a security perspective.
  • Coach teams on security-by-design principles.

Technical Skills

  • CI/CD pipeline security (SAST/DAST, container scanning).
  • Secrets management (key/certificate rotation, secure storage).
  • Endpoint/server hardening (CIS benchmarks).
  • Encryption technologies (TLS, certificates, key management).

Experience

  • Modernization projects maintaining/improving security posture.
  • Regulatory compliance (ISO 27001, SOC 2, PCI DSS).

Secondary Skills

  • Zero-trust architecture.
  • Policy-as-code (Open Policy Agent).
  • SRE/observability (SLIs/SLOs, error budgets).
  • Data classification/DLP/privacy-by-design.

Certifications

  • CISSP, CISM, SABSA, CCSP, GIAC, or equivalent.

Application Process: - Email resumes to Careers@reflectionsinfos.com with notice period, current, and expected CTC. - Warning: No payment is required for jobs at Reflections. Contact the official HR email for verification.

Note: All employment-related communications are sent via the official website or LinkedIn.
summary: The Security Architect designs and governs security architecture for mission-critical on-premises systems, ensuring compliance and collaboration across teams. They implement security controls and drive secure DevOps practices.

Role: Software Demo Expert – FinTech

Eligibility: Male candidates from Calicut, Palakkad, Koytayam, Thrissur Closing Date: 31 Dec 2025 Published Date: 11 Dec 2025

About the Role

We’re hiring a Software Solutions Expert to join our friendly sales team! If you enjoy technology, communication, and learning, this is your chance. Key responsibilities include: - Demonstrating software solutions to clients - Building relationships through client visits - Learning and mastering FinTech tools

Qualifications

  • Any degree
  • Strong communication skills
  • Comfortable with travel
  • Willingness to learn
  • Bonus: Experience in B2B sales (banking/finance/jewelry) is preferred

What We Offer

  • Salary: ₹18,000 - ₹25,000/month + performance-based incentives
  • Travel Allowance: ₹200/day
  • Comprehensive training and support

How to Apply

Email your resume to hr@ignosi.co.in or call 9778196774.

job_title: KOLLAM MANAGER – IGNOSI - IoT Security & Banking Solutions
job_description:
IGNOSI ENTERPRISES Ground Floor, Tejaswini Building, Technopark, Trivandrum, 695581 http://www.ignosi.in

KOLLAM MANAGER – IGNOSI - IoT Security & Banking Solutions Closing Date: 31, Dec 2025 Job Published: 11, Dec 2025 Contact Email: hr@ignosi.co.in

About Us

We deliver a complete shield of security and performance for financiers and banking institutions. From smart IoT surveillance and AI monitoring to essential banking hardware and gold appraisal support, we ensure every bank becomes a digital fortress.

Role Overview

The Shop Manager will serve as the operational commander of the store, ensuring the business is fully functional from day one. You will build and lead a sales team, manage appraiser onboarding, maintain inventory and supplier relationships, and deliver excellent customer service to banking and NBFC clients.

Key Responsibilities

Business Setup & Operations - Establish the shop operations from scratch and ensure daily readiness of the showroom/service center - Maintain stock, coordinate procurement, and handle vendor negotiations - Support installation and servicing coordination for IoT security devices

Sales & Customer Acquisition - Recruit and manage field sales executives - Achieve sales targets for hardware, security systems, and service contracts - Build strong relationships with private bankers, NBFCs, jewel finance companies, and other financial institutions - Conduct client visits, demos, and presentations

Team & Partner Management - Add certified gold appraisers under the manager and supervise their assignments - Coordinate legal advocate service requests from banks - Ensure timely servicing, support, and complaint resolution

Finance & Reporting - Manage billing, collections, and asset movements - Maintain business accounts and create performance reports for management

Preferred Skills & Qualifications

  • Minimum 2–5 years of experience in banking solutions, electronics, or security product sales
  • Strong negotiation and communication abilities
  • Leadership qualities to build and mentor a strong field team
  • Basic accounting and computer knowledge
  • Ability to travel locally for client acquisition and service follow-up
  • Banking industry relationships are a big advantage

What We Offer

  • Competitive salary + Incentives + Travel allowance
  • Opportunity to scale into a regional leadership role
  • Training in latest AI-driven fintech security technologies

Who Should Apply?

If you love challenges, enjoy meeting clients, and want to build something big from the ground up, this role is your launchpad.

SALARY: ₹22,000 - ₹25,000
summary: Lead IoT and banking security operations, manage sales teams, and build client relationships. Requires 2-5 years in sales or security solutions with leadership skills.
